title: WBD Promotes Discovery’s Joseph Boyle & TLC’s Alon Orstein

facts.content_line: New Role: Joseph Boyle, Head of Content, Discovery Channel at Warner Bros. Discovery (12/18) Boyle reports to Howard Lee, Chief Creative Officer of U.S. Networks and will oversee content development and production for Discovery Channel; credited with series including Deadliest Catch and Naked and Afraid
summary_bullets: New Role: Joseph Boyle, Head of Content, Discovery Channel at Warner Bros. Discovery (12/18) Boyle reports to Howard Lee, Chief Creative Officer of U.S. Networks and will oversee content development and production for Discovery Channel; credited with series including Deadliest Catch and Naked and Afraid

facts.content_line: New Role: Alon Orstein, Head of Content, TLC at Warner Bros. Discovery (12/18) Orstein reports to Howard Lee, Chief Creative Officer of U.S. Networks and will oversee content development and production for TLC; credits include the 90 Day Fiancé franchise, Sister Wives, Say Yes to the Dress, Cake Boss and I Am Jazz
summary_bullets: New Role: Alon Orstein, Head of Content, TLC at Warner Bros. Discovery (12/18) Orstein reports to Howard Lee, Chief Creative Officer of U.S. Networks and will oversee content development and production for TLC; credits include the 90 Day Fiancé franchise, Sister Wives, Say Yes to the Dress, Cake Boss and I Am Jazz

title: Longtime Zaslav Aide David Leavy Exits Warner Bros Discovery

facts.content_line: Exit: David Leavy, Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at Warner Bros. Discovery (12/18) Leavy, a 25‑year WBD veteran and longtime aide to CEO David Zaslav, announced he will leave at the end of the year; he has no immediate next role and plans to take family time over the holidays
summary_bullets: Exit: David Leavy, Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at Warner Bros. Discovery (12/18) Leavy, a 25‑year WBD veteran and longtime aide to CEO David Zaslav, announced he will leave at the end of the year; he has no immediate next role and plans to take family time over the holidays

title: New Warner Bros. Contemporary Film Label Being Launched
classification_notes: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Warner Bros. Motion Picture Group executives Michael De Luca and Pam Abdy are launching a new contemporary film label that will focus on smartly budgeted global theatrical releases
summary_bullets: Warner Bros. Motion Picture Group executives Michael De Luca and Pam Abdy are launching a new contemporary film label that will focus on smartly budgeted global theatrical releases

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Christian Parkes, former Neon Chief Marketing Officer and architect of the Longlegs and Parasite campaigns, will lead the new label
summary_bullets: Christian Parkes, former Neon Chief Marketing Officer and architect of the Longlegs and Parasite campaigns, will lead the new label

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Jason Wald, formerly EVP of Acquisitions & Production at Neon, will serve as Head of Acquisitions & Production for the label
summary_bullets: Jason Wald, formerly EVP of Acquisitions & Production at Neon, will serve as Head of Acquisitions & Production for the label

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Spener Collantes, formerly Neon’s VP of Creative Marketing, will serve as VP, Marketing & Creative for the label
summary_bullets: Spener Collantes, formerly Neon’s VP of Creative Marketing, will serve as VP, Marketing & Creative for the label

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: The label will concentrate on lower-cost films aimed at digital natives and Gen Z with zeitgeist-driving content and highly efficient targeted digital marketing campaigns
summary_bullets: The label will concentrate on lower-cost films aimed at digital natives and Gen Z with zeitgeist-driving content and highly efficient targeted digital marketing campaigns

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: The venture will acquire independent films and develop new in-house projects for global theatrical release while targeting two-to-three titles annually
summary_bullets: The venture will acquire independent films and develop new in-house projects for global theatrical release while targeting two-to-three titles annually

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: The label is intended to meet exhibitor demand for more diverse theatrical product beyond blockbusters and to apply innovative, digitally focused promotional strategies for each release
summary_bullets: The label is intended to meet exhibitor demand for more diverse theatrical product beyond blockbusters and to apply innovative, digitally focused promotional strategies for each release

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Warner Bros. expects to officially name the label by the Sundance Film Festival next month
summary_bullets: Warner Bros. expects to officially name the label by the Sundance Film Festival next month

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: The initiative pre-dates plans to split Warner Bros. Discovery and the acceptance of Netflix’s bid for WBD motion picture, TV production, and HBO Max assets, reflecting a proactive studio strategy
summary_bullets: The initiative pre-dates plans to split Warner Bros. Discovery and the acceptance of Netflix’s bid for WBD motion picture, TV production, and HBO Max assets, reflecting a proactive studio strategy

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: The label is positioned differently from past Warner specialty arms like Warner Independent and Picturehouse by focusing on a smaller, highly targeted slate rather than a half-dozen releases per year
summary_bullets: The label is positioned differently from past Warner specialty arms like Warner Independent and Picturehouse by focusing on a smaller, highly targeted slate rather than a half-dozen releases per year

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: Warner Bros. Discovery’s Q3 2025 shareholder letter frames the studio’s slate around tentpoles, DC films, New Line releases, animation, and a select number of moderately budgeted originals to which this label will contribute two-to-three annual titles
summary_bullets: Warner Bros. Discovery’s Q3 2025 shareholder letter frames the studio’s slate around tentpoles, DC films, New Line releases, animation, and a select number of moderately budgeted originals to which this label will contribute two-to-three annual titles

facts.category_path: Content, Deals & Distribution -> Film -> General News & Strategy
facts.content_line: The article notes Netflix leadership has signaled support for theatrical releases and cites Parrot Analytics data indicating movies remain an efficient tool for streamers to drive engagement and reduce churn
summary_bullets: The article notes Netflix leadership has signaled support for theatrical releases and cites Parrot Analytics data indicating movies remain an efficient tool for streamers to drive engagement and reduce churn
